title: How to Make Ukrainian Tea Cookies

steps.headline: Remove the cooked egg yolk from a boiled egg.
steps.description: Discard the egg whites or use them elsewhere.

steps.headline: Crumble the egg yolk into the sugar and stir until well blended and the sugar looks pale yellow.
Melt the butter and add it to the sugar/yolk mixture.
Add the flours and combine well.
Allow the dough to sit for 3-5 minutes for the flour to absorb the moisture and for the gluten to bind.
Roll the dough into 1 inch (2.5 cm) logs.
Cut 1-inch sections from the log and hand roll them into balls.
Shake the balls of dough in a bowl of brown sugar until coated.
Place dough balls on waxed paper on a baking pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 18 minutes.
steps.description: (Bottoms will be brown while the tops remain pale tan.)

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and cool on a separate pan or cooling rack.

text: Remove the cooked egg yolk from a boiled egg. Discard the egg whites or use them elsewhere. Crumble the egg yolk into the sugar and stir until well blended and the sugar looks pale yellow.  Melt the butter and add it to the sugar/yolk mixture.  Add vanilla to taste (approximately 2 tsp).  Add cinnamon to taste (approximately 2 tsp).  Combine well.  Add the flours and combine well.  Allow the dough to sit for 3-5 minutes for the flour to absorb the moisture and for the gluten to bind.  Roll the dough into 1 inch (2.5 cm) logs.  Cut 1-inch sections from the log and hand roll them into balls.  Shake the balls of dough in a bowl of brown sugar until coated.  Place dough balls on waxed paper on a baking pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 18 minutes. (Bottoms will be brown while the tops remain pale tan.) Remove from the oven and cool on a separate pan or cooling rack. Enjoy!
